body: Marking it as "breaking change" as well: even if I fix the documentation, others would still need to apply the changes.

issue.title: Fixing documentation regarding OIDC with GitHub
issue.body:
Fix #42546

Includes a new screenshot with the corrected example.

body:
Hi @Sanne 

>It would be really nice to also have a "how to debug things when they don't work" section in the OIDC guide, for example even just suggesting which log levels to set to get some more clues would have saved me a bunch of time.

Improving the debug related dev experience would be one of the main task for the proposed OIDC working group, I did not highlight it yet, but it definitely will be.

Let me drop the breaking change label though as the actual application registration (specifying the redirect URLs in the GitHub dashboard, etc) is not something Quarkus can control. 
Sorry the confusion, we'll definitely need to replace the Renarde images here, I'll open a task
@Sanne It may be indeed a breaking change issue though at the Renarde level

@sberyozkin I'd still call it a breaking change, as an upgrade of Quarkus will break the application unless the developer does something about it...
I understand the purpose of the label is to highlight to users that they need to be aware of something when they upgrade?
And if it's a breaking change, I believe we should also figure out when it broke and document that.
